description: IT governance not aligned with institutional priorities leading to poor SOX control oversight
Lack of designated leadership for IT operations causing inconsistent SOX control implementation
No information security leadership resulting in inadequate protection of financial data
Absence of succession planning for key IT leaders creating SOX control gaps
Exclusion of stakeholders from IT investment decisions impacting financial system controls
Unprioritized IT assets leading to uncontrolled SOX-relevant systems
Outdated IT systems unable to support proper financial reporting controls
Failure to communicate IT management aims causing inconsistent control execution
Lack of shared IT-business understanding resulting in control design flaws
Poor IT project management leading to uncontrolled financial system changes
No IT cost allocation process obscuring financial control investments
Missing IT performance measurements preventing control effectiveness monitoring
No IT problem management process allowing control failures to recur
Incorrect public-facing information including financial disclosures
Critical financial data unavailability during reporting periods
Prolonged loss of access to financial systems hosted externally
Unprotected IT communications exposing financial data transmissions
Inaccessible data centers preventing financial system operations
No business continuity plans for extended financial system outages
Unvetted third-party services processing financial data
Inadequate policies for protecting financial data confidentiality
Data breaches exposing sensitive financial information
Poor cybersecurity incident response compromising financial systems
Excessive logical access to financial systems violating least privilege
Uncontrolled physical access to financial system hardware
No lifecycle management for financial IT assets
Undocumented IT infrastructure changes affecting financial systems
Unmapped financial data flows between systems
Unmaintained licenses for financial software
No process ensuring financial data accuracy during processing
Missing audit logs for financial system activities
Insufficient IT staff to maintain financial system controls
Users violating policies when handling financial data
Non-compliance with regulations governing financial data
Unauthorized production code deployments bypassing testing requirements
Developers pushing untested code to production environments
Lack of pre-production testing for financial system code changes
Git push directly to production branch without pull request
CI/CD pipelines configured to skip testing stages
